box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(128, 128, 128); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
Describes frame(s) format(s) & how to display each value.
The JSON map file contains indices ("%1, %2, %3", ...) which
are used to represent an element contained in the received
frames from the current device.

switch.text: Describes frame(s) format(s) & how to display each value...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 609px; margin-left: 1456px;

display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(128, 128, 128); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: nowrap;

div.div: Selected from User Interface, managed by CSV Import/Export module

switch.text: Selected from User Interface, managed by CSV Import/Export module

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 400px; margin-left: 1113px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 473px; margin-left: 1747px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
div.font:
External "plugins" or applications can interact
with Serial Studio by reading/writing data
on a local TCP port (7777).
When a "plugin" writes to the TCP port,
Serial Studio shall send the received data
to the current device.
When the current device sends something,
Serial Studio shall send the received data
to the connected plugins/applications.
Why use network ports? Because we want
developers to write their plugins in their preferred
programming languages and IDEs, not force them
to use Qt.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 668px; margin-left: 567px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

font.span:
Each received frame is converted to a JSON
document by replacing the "%1, %2, %3" indices
in the map file with data received from the current device.
This process is executed in a different thread for
each received frame.
Because we are using threads, we cannot guarantee
that the "output" JSON documents will come in
the original order (see issue #35).
In order to mitigate this, each frame is placed
inside a "JSON Frame Information" structure (JFI).
This structure contains:
- The JSON document
- RX date/time
- Frame number (uint64_t) -> in case that the RX/date
time is the same in high-frequency data samples.

switch.text: Each received frame is converted to a JSON...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 158px; height: 1px; padding-top: 168px; margin-left: 1266px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(128, 128, 128); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
div.div: Serial Studio can "publish" RX data to a MQTT broker or
"subscribe" to an MQTT topic & display incoming data
(using exactly the same JSON map file as the "publisher" instance).

switch.text: Serial Studio can "publish" RX data to a MQTT broker or...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 668px; margin-left: 897px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

font.span:
Serial Studio generates a CSV file with the received information.
This file can later be imported to other applications (e.g. Excel,
MATLAB, etc) or opened with Serial Studio again.

switch.text: Serial Studio generates a CSV file with the received informa...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 318px; margin-left: 117px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

font.span:
The I/O manager reads incoming data, creates a list of
frames & provides integrity checks (CRC8, CRC16 or
CRC32).

switch.text: The I/O manager reads incoming data, creates a lis...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 158px; height: 1px; padding-top: 198px; margin-left: 426px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 198px; margin-left: 117px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

font.span:
The console module formats RX data for display in
in the UI. Data can be displayed in normal (ASCII) mode
or in binary/hexadecimal mode.
Users can interact with the current device by sending
ASCII or binary data via HEX representation.

switch.text: The console module formats RX data for display in...

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(128, 128, 128); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
div.div: Widgets are generated with C++ for better

box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 498px; margin-left: 367px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;

font.span:
The HAL (Hardware Abstraction Layer)
provides a common driver structure for
I/O operations. This allows Serial Studio
to interact with a wide range of devices
and data sources.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 693px; margin-left: 97px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
div.font:
Note: only one data source/driver
can be used at a given time.

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
